instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> replacement keyboards vendors
threads.message:
Hello,
I apologize if this is not the right place to ask, but I didnt find which of the forum section (Macbook Logic Board Repair, Tools, Business talk, Off topic, iPhone, Diet...) was the most relevant for that.

I will have to buy a few replacement keyboards (and Touchbar) for <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> and <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBP next week; how reliable are the replacements parts wrt original ? Any recommendation in terms of vendor? Given the time it takes, I don't want to have to replace the replacement keyboard...

Also, on store.rossmann, keyboard section, there is no replacement parts for <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>/<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>. There are for <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, but not after. Is there any specific reasons to this, such as unavailability or lack of reliability ?

Also, what kind of tool do you use to thread the new holes, so that the screws stay in place in the rivets' holes ?

Thanks for your time,

KR
S.
